It looks identical physically (besides the model label) to the [[Atheros AR5BCB-00032]]. ==Notes== ===lspci -nnv dump=== 
06:00.0 Ethernet controller [0200]: Qualcomm Atheros AR5212/AR5213 Wireless Network Adapter [168c:0013] (rev 01)
        Subsystem: Qualcomm Atheros Device [168c:1031]
        Flags: bus master, medium devsel, latency 168, IRQ 19
        Memory at f1d00000 (32-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=64K]
        Capabilities: [44] Power Management version 2
        Kernel driver in use: ath5k
===ath5k info dump=== 
[99672.831390] ath: EEPROM regdomain: 0x0
[99672.831393] ath: EEPROM indicates default country code should be used
[99672.831393] ath: doing EEPROM country->regdmn map search
[99672.831394] ath: country maps to regdmn code: 0x3a
[99672.831395] ath: Country alpha2 being used: US
[99672.831396] ath: Regpair used: 0x3a
[99672.831531] ieee80211 phy12: Selected rate control algorithm 'minstrel_ht'
[99672.831898] ath5k: phy12: Atheros AR5212 chip found (MAC: 0x56, PHY: 0x41)
[99672.831901] ath5k: phy12: RF5112B multiband radio found (0x36)
[99672.908130] IPv6: ADDRCONF(NETDEV_UP): wlan154: link is not ready
